intro: Agathosma uncinata, commonly known as African sage, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round, red fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it is valued in traditional herbal medicine.
